result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:09 PM Defendant Kristopher Gary Lehnhardt in court.  Attorney Barbara J Kirchner in court for Kristopher Gary Lehnhardt.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Kirchner requests to remove GPS. State does not object. Court removes GPS and amendment to no violent or abusive contact as to one individual. Jury date already on the calendar. As previously set MIL/WL/JI due 11.23.22 .

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 12:39 PM Defendant Kristopher Gary Lehnhardt in court with attorney Barbara J Kirchner.  Defendant Kristopher Gary Lehnhardt in custody.  Rebecca Meyer appeared for the Wisconsin, State of. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Information was filed/accepted on 4/13/22. Defense received info and waived it's reading. Reserves right to a jury trial. NG plea entered on both counts.  Defense bond motion to amend to $500 cash and allow deft to return to his residence as victim no longer resides in WI. State object to cash bond modification.  State does have an updated FL address for the victim but hasn't verbally comfirmed with the Victim Witness office.  Court feels $500 cash would be too low and would also like the State to have Victim/Witness confirm w/the victim the updated FL address. Per the State, victim has not requested services. Court adjourns BBH to tomorrow for the State to have Victim Witness reach out to the victim regarding their updated/permanent address.
